column4: okay, I feel kinda silly... I just setup a new computer running a RAID5 with 3 drives, BIOS knows it's a raid and "Intel Matrix Manager" says the 3 drives are all configured as part of the raid, but when I use the installer to begin partitioning the raid it's showing me sda sdb and sdc (all at 0,0,0). Is there something I'm doing wrong?
take a look at this, in particular the first two topics https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FakeRaidHowto
i was trying to get ubuntu installed on a raid0 configuration using intel raid
lol, yep...i know what ya mean, software raid that looks like hardware raid ;p
